Notes.Text:
This update for python-Authlib fixes the following issues:

Changes in python-Authlib:

- CVE-2025-68158: Fixed 1-click account takeover in applications that use the Authlib library (bsc#1256414)
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: Authlib is a Python library which builds OAuth and OpenID Connect servers. In version 1.6.5 and prior, cache-backed state/request-token storage is not tied to the initiating user session, so CSRF is possible for any attacker that has a valid state (easily obtainable via an attacker-initiated authentication flow). When a cache is supplied to the OAuth client registry, FrameworkIntegration.set_state_data writes the entire state blob under _state_{app}_{state}, and get_state_data ignores the caller's session altogether. This issue has been patched in version 1.6.6.
